intro: Conostylis occulta, commonly known as the hidden conostylis, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. This perennial herb typically grows in coastal dunes and sandy soils, exhibiting a low, spreading growth habit. Its inflorescence consists of compact, spike-like clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant is adapted to withstand saline and arid conditions, making it a resilient component of its native habitat.
